question_stem.en: A 58-year-old man undergoes operative repair of a descending thoracic aortic aneurysm. There are no intraoperative complications, but postoperatively the patient is found to have new-onset neurologic deficits. Imaging of the brain is normal, but MRI of the lower thoracic spinal cord reveals ischemic infarct of the areas shown in the exhibit below {{exhibit_1}}.
question_stem.zh: 一名 58 岁男性接受降主动脉胸主动脉瘤的手术修复。术中没有发生并发症，但在术后发现患者出现新发神经功能缺损。脑部影像学检查正常，但胸下段脊髓的 MRI 显示，在下面的图片{{exhibit_1}}中显示的区域发生缺血性梗死。

question.en: Lower extremity examination of this patient is most likely to show which of the following neurologic findings?

explanation.en:
This patient's thoracic aortic aneurysm repair has been complicated by ischemic injury to the anterior two-thirds of the spinal cord (SC). This area is perfused by the anterior spinal artery, which receives blood flow from segmental arteries (eg, intercostal arteries) arising off the thoracic aorta. Disruption of circulation to this area classically results in anterior cord syndrome, characterized by the following bilateral tract lesions and clinical signs:

*   Spinothalamic tract (STT): loss of pain/temperature (lateral spinothalamic) and crude touch (anterior spinothalamic) sensation 1-2 levels below the lesion
*   Anterior horn (lower motor neuron): flaccid paralysis and muscle atrophy at the level of the lesion
*   Lateral corticospinal tract (CST) (upper motor neuron): paralysis below the level of the lesion. Flaccid paralysis from spinal shock (ie, temporary loss of all distal SC function) occurs initially, but upper motor neuron signs (eg, spasticity, hyperreflexia) subsequently develop over days to weeks

As in this patient, the dorsal columns are typically spared (due to intact circulation from the posterior spinal arteries), preserving proprioceptive, vibratory, and light touch sensation below the level of the lesion.

(Choice B) Complete loss of all lower extremity sensation (due to injury of the STTs and dorsal columns) and motor function (due to injury of the CSTs) may be seen in complete SC injury, as can occur in SC transection.

(Choices C and E) An isolated defect of crude touch sensation or pain/temperature sensation could occur only with isolated injury to the anterior or lateral STT, respectively. Because the anterior spinal artery also supplies the tracts (eg, CSTs) surrounding the STTs, it is extremely uncommon to have bilateral injury to only the anterior or lateral STT.

(Choice D) Diminished proprioception and motor function can occur with simultaneous injury to the dorsal columns and CSTs. A classic cause is subacute combined degeneration of the dorsal and lateral SC white matter, which is seen in vitamin B12 deficiency.

(Choice F) Selective loss of proprioceptive (along with vibratory and light touch) sensation occurs with isolated injury of the bilateral dorsal columns. A classic example is tabes dorsalis, a form of tertiary neurosyphilis that causes damage to the dorsal columns and dorsal nerve roots.

Educational objective:
Ischemia of the anterior two-thirds of the spinal cord can occur with disruption of the anterior spinal artery blood supply. The resulting anterior cord syndrome causes bilateral distal loss of pain, temperature, and crude touch sensation (from injury to the spinothalamic tracts) and paralysis (from injury to the lateral corticospinal tracts). {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}}
explanation.zh:
该患者的胸主动脉瘤修复术因脊髓前 2/3 的缺血性损伤而出现并发症。该区域由脊髓前动脉灌注，该动脉接收来自节段动脉（例如，肋间动脉）的血液，这些动脉起源于胸主动脉。该区域的循环中断通常会导致前脊髓综合征，其特征是以下双侧束损伤和临床体征：

*   脊髓丘脑束 (STT)：在损伤平面以下 1-2 个节段出现疼痛/温度（外侧脊髓丘脑束）和触觉（前脊髓丘脑束）感觉丧失
*   前角（下运动神经元）：损伤平面的弛缓性麻痹和肌肉萎缩
*   外侧皮质脊髓束 (CST)（上运动神经元）：损伤平面以下的麻痹。最初发生来自脊髓休克的弛缓性麻痹（即，所有远端脊髓功能的暂时性丧失），但上运动神经元体征（例如，痉挛、反射亢进）随后在数天到数周内出现

与该患者一样，后柱通常被保留（由于来自后脊髓动脉的完整循环），从而保留了损伤平面以下的本体感觉、振动觉和轻触觉。

(选项 B) STT 和后柱损伤可能导致所有下肢感觉（STT 和后柱损伤）和运动功能（CST 损伤）的完全丧失，这可能发生在完全性脊髓损伤中，如脊髓横断。

(选项 C 和 E) 仅当分别单独损伤前或外侧 STT 时，才会出现触觉或疼痛/温度感觉的孤立性缺陷。由于脊髓前动脉也为 STT 周围的束（例如，CST）供血，因此仅对前或外侧 STT 造成双侧损伤的情况极为罕见。

(选项 D) 本体感觉和运动功能下降可能发生在同时损伤后柱和 CST 时。一个经典的病因是维生素 B12 缺乏症中出现的后柱和外侧脊髓白质的亚急性联合变性。

(选项 F) 本体感觉（以及振动觉和轻触觉）的选择性丧失发生在双侧后柱的孤立性损伤中。一个经典的例子是脊髓痨，这是一种三期神经梅毒，会导致后柱和后神经根损伤。

教育目标：
脊髓前 2/3 的缺血可能因脊髓前动脉血供中断而发生。由此产生的前脊髓综合征导致双侧远端疼痛、温度和触觉感觉丧失（源于脊髓丘脑束损伤）和麻痹（源于外侧皮质脊髓束损伤）。{{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of anterior cord syndrome, its etiology (anterior spinal artery ischemia), and the resulting neurological deficits (loss of pain/temperature/crude touch, paralysis, but preserved proprioception). It requires understanding of spinal cord anatomy and the function of different spinal tracts.

To solve this question, recognize the clinical scenario of postoperative aortic aneurysm repair complicated by neurological deficits. Identify the MRI findings suggestive of anterior spinal cord ischemia. Recall the characteristic features of anterior cord syndrome to select the correct pattern of sensory and motor loss.
summary.zh:
此题考察对前脊髓综合征、其病因（脊髓前动脉缺血）以及由此产生的神经功能缺损（疼痛/温度/触觉丧失、麻痹，但本体感觉保留）的了解。这需要理解脊髓解剖结构和不同脊髓束的功能。

要解决这个问题，需要认识到术后主动脉瘤修复因神经功能缺损而出现并发症的临床情况。确定提示脊髓前部缺血的 MRI 结果。回忆前脊髓综合征的特征，以选择正确的感觉和运动功能丧失模式。
